page.title: 02HOUSING IN HEREFORD CITY
page.content:
Four distinct types of housing occur in the City of Hereford.
The earliest are very large. Few remain as family homes. Many have been subdivided, converted to hotels or nursing homes or acquired as annexes to schools and colleges.
The second category are those large semi-detatched houses, erected between the wars along the main routes to the city.They are mainly owner occupied.
The council houses erected at very high density during the 1960's and 70's account for the third category.
The fourth category includes those low density houses erected during the 1980's. They are owner occupied and of individual architecture.
